intro: Aspidogyne carauchana, commonly known as the Caribbean starleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Aspidogyne carauchana is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
